main event: Multiple aircraft reported sighting bright lights and flares in the sky over the Hawaiian Islands on March 17, 1960.
interesting points: A C-54 aircraft spotted a bright light at coordinates 20-44N 158-54W, which faded after about 30 seconds.
Clipper 842 reported seeing the same light at coordinates 20-48.5N 158-18.5W.
Clipper 230 reported seeing a descending light at coordinates 21-50N 158-30W.
All the aircraft were flying at altitudes between 9,000 and 11,000 feet while en route to the mainland.
The sightings were reported to various military commands, including CINCPACAF, COMUSEAFRON, CINCNORAD, CINCPAC, and CINCUSARPAC.
